intro: Klasea aphyllopoda, commonly known as the leafless rock cress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. Despite its name, it does produce small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has a compact, mat-forming growth habit with dense clusters of tiny, scale-like leaves. It is adapted to survive in harsh environments with minimal water availability.
